meanings.definition: To play the position of quarterback in a football game.
meanings.sent1: During the game, he quarterbacked his team to victory with precise throws.
meanings.sent2: The quarterbacked player called the plays and threw the ball to his teammates.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel quarterbacked the other animals in a game of acorn toss.
meanings.sent4: She quarterbacked the project, guiding each team member like a skilled captain.
meanings.sent5: His ability to quarterback the offense made him a valuable asset to the team.

meanings.definition: To lead or direct a team or group in a strategic manner.
meanings.sent1: She quarterbacked the debate team to success by organizing their arguments.
meanings.sent2: The manager quarterbacked the project, ensuring each task was completed on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat quarterbacked the mice in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: He quarterbacked the company through tough times, making wise decisions.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to quarterback the team's marketing efforts led to increased sales.
